seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL system procedure

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL system procedure

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL</codeph> system procedure loads and unloads optional tools packages.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL</codeph> system procedure loads and unloads optional tools packages.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL</codeph> system procedure loads and unloads optional tools packages.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

trans-unit.source: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL(IN TOOLNAME VARCHAR(128), IN REGISTER BOOLEAN, IN OPTIONALARGS VARCHAR(128) ... )

seg-source.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL(IN TOOLNAME VARCHAR(128), IN REGISTER BOOLEAN, IN OPTIONALARGS VARCHAR(128) ...

target.mrk: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_REGISTER_TOOL(IN TOOLNAME VARCHAR(128), IN REGISTER BOOLEAN, IN OPTIONALARGS VARCHAR(128) ...

trans-unit.source: No result set is returned by this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: No result set is returned by this procedure.

target.mrk: No result set is returned by this procedure.

seg-source.mrk: TOOLNAME

target.mrk: TOOLNAME

trans-unit.source: The name of the optional tool. Must be either <codeph>'databaseMetaData'</codeph> or <codeph>'foreignViews'</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the optional tool.
Must be either <codeph>'databaseMetaData'</codeph> or <codeph>'foreignViews'</codeph>.

target.mrk: The name of the optional tool.
Must be either <codeph>'databaseMetaData'</codeph> or <codeph>'foreignViews'</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: REGISTER

target.mrk: REGISTER

trans-unit.source: A value of true tells <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to load the tool. A value of false tells <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to unload the tool.

seg-source.mrk: A value of true tells <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to load the tool.
A value of false tells <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to unload the tool.

target.mrk: A value of true tells <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to load the tool.
A value of false tells <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to unload the tool.

seg-source.mrk: OPTIONALARGS

target.mrk: OPTIONALARGS

trans-unit.source: Optional arguments specific to each tool.

seg-source.mrk: Optional arguments specific to each tool.

target.mrk: Optional arguments specific to each tool.

seg-source.mrk: Execute privileges

target.mrk: Execute privileges

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: Usage

target.mrk: Usage

trans-unit.source: The following optional tools are supported:

seg-source.mrk: The following optional tools are supported:

target.mrk: The following optional tools are supported:

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>databaseMetaData</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>databaseMetaData</codeph>

trans-unit.source: This optional tool creates functions and table functions to wrap the methods in java.sql.DatabaseMetaData, allowing you to use DatabaseMetaData methods in queries. For example, you can join and filter the ResultSets returned by DatabaseMetaData methods. This tool does not require any optional arguments. To create the metadata functions and table functions, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: This optional tool creates functions and table functions to wrap the methods in java.sql.DatabaseMetaData, allowing you to use DatabaseMetaData methods in queries.
For example, you can join and filter the ResultSets returned by DatabaseMetaData methods.
This tool does not require any optional arguments.
To create the metadata functions and table functions, do the following:

target.mrk: This optional tool creates functions and table functions to wrap the methods in java.sql.DatabaseMetaData, allowing you to use DatabaseMetaData methods in queries.
For example, you can join and filter the ResultSets returned by DatabaseMetaData methods.
This tool does not require any optional arguments.
To create the metadata functions and table functions, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'databaseMetaData', true )

target.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'databaseMetaData', true )

trans-unit.source: To drop the functions and table functions, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: To drop the functions and table functions, do the following:

target.mrk: To drop the functions and table functions, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'databaseMetaData', false )

target.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'databaseMetaData', false )

seg-source.mrk: <codeph>foreignViews</codeph>

target.mrk: <codeph>foreignViews</codeph>

trans-unit.source: This optional tool creates schemas, table functions, and convenience views for all user tables in a foreign database. The table functions and views are useful for bulk-importing foreign data into <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>. This tool takes two additional arguments:

seg-source.mrk: This optional tool creates schemas, table functions, and convenience views for all user tables in a foreign database.
The table functions and views are useful for bulk-importing foreign data into <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
This tool takes two additional arguments:

target.mrk: This optional tool creates schemas, table functions, and convenience views for all user tables in a foreign database.
The table functions and views are useful for bulk-importing foreign data into <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
This tool takes two additional arguments:

seg-source.mrk: CONNECTION_URL

target.mrk: CONNECTION_URL

trans-unit.source: This is a connection URL string suitable for creating a connection to the foreign database by calling DriverManager.getConnection().

seg-source.mrk: This is a connection URL string suitable for creating a connection to the foreign database by calling DriverManager.getConnection().

target.mrk: This is a connection URL string suitable for creating a connection to the foreign database by calling DriverManager.getConnection().

seg-source.mrk: SCHEMA_PREFIX

target.mrk: SCHEMA_PREFIX

trans-unit.source: This is an optional string prefixed to all of the schema names which the tool creates. This argument may be omitted. If it is omitted, then the tool will create schemas which have the same names as the schemas in the foreign database.

seg-source.mrk: This is an optional string prefixed to all of the schema names which the tool creates.
This argument may be omitted.
If it is omitted, then the tool will create schemas which have the same names as the schemas in the foreign database.

target.mrk: This is an optional string prefixed to all of the schema names which the tool creates.
This argument may be omitted.
If it is omitted, then the tool will create schemas which have the same names as the schemas in the foreign database.

trans-unit.source: To create views on the foreign data, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: To create views on the foreign data, do the following:

target.mrk: To create views on the foreign data, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'foreignViews', true, 'foreignDatabaseURL', 'XYZ_' )

target.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'foreignViews', true, 'foreignDatabaseURL', 'XYZ_' )

trans-unit.source: To drop the views on the foreign data, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: To drop the views on the foreign data, do the following:

target.mrk: To drop the views on the foreign data, do the following:

seg-source.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'foreignViews', false, 'foreignDatabaseURL', 'XYZ_' )

target.mrk: call syscs_util.syscs_register_tool( 'foreignViews', false, 'foreignDatabaseURL', 'XYZ_' )

trans-unit.source: See the for more information on how to use these tools. Before you run an optional tool, make sure that your classpath contains the jar files, including derbytools.jar.

seg-source.mrk: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citutilities"></ph> for more information on how to use these tools.
Before you run an optional tool, make sure that your classpath contains the jar files, including derbytools.jar.

target.mrk: See the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citutilities"></ph> for more information on how to use these tools.
Before you run an optional tool, make sure that your classpath contains the jar files, including derbytools.jar.
